intro: Trichopteryx catangensis, commonly known as the catangensis thornapple, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed-related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or orange. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Trichopteryx catangensis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils.
